entry.def: When you pick something up, you lift it up.

example.ex: He picked his cap up from the floor and stuck it back on his head...
example.tran: 他从地板上拾起帽子，重新戴在头上。

example.ex: Ridley picked up a pencil and fiddled with it.
example.tran: 里德利拿起一支铅笔，不停地在手里摆弄着。

entry.def: When you pick yourself up after you have fallen or been knocked down, you stand up rather slowly.
entry.tran: （跌倒或被击倒后）使（自己）慢慢站起（或爬起）

example.ex: Anthony picked himself up and set off along the track.
example.tran: 安东尼自己慢慢爬起来，又开始沿着跑道跑下去。

entry.def: When you pick up someone or something that is waiting to be collected, you go to the place where they are and take them away, often in a car.

example.ex: We drove to the airport the next morning to pick up Susan...
example.tran: 我们第二天早晨开车去机场接苏姗。

example.ex: She went over to her parents' house to pick up some clean clothes...
example.tran: 她去了趟父母家取些干净衣服。

entry.def: If someone is picked up by the police, they are arrested and taken to a police station.

example.ex: Rawlings had been picked up by police at his office...
example.tran: 罗林斯已在办公室遭警察拘捕。

example.ex: The police picked him up within the hour.
example.tran: 警察不到一小时就将他逮捕了。

entry.def: If you pick up something such as a skill or an idea, you acquire it without effort over a period of time.

example.ex: Where did you pick up your English?...
example.tran: 你在哪儿学的英语？

example.ex: Young people are picking up ideas about good drugs and bad drugs.
example.tran: 年轻人正在形成毒品有好坏之分的观念。

entry.def: If you pick up someone you do not know, you talk to them and try to start a sexual relationship with them.
entry.tran: （以发生性关系为目的）搭识，与…搭讪

example.ex: He had picked her up at a nightclub on Kallari Street, where she worked as a singer.
example.tran: 他是在卡拉里街的一家夜总会和她搭上的，她在那儿当歌手。

entry.def: If you pick up an illness, you get it from somewhere or something.

example.ex: They've picked up a really nasty infection from something they've eaten.
example.tran: 他们因吃错东西而得了很严重的感染症。

entry.def: If a piece of equipment, for example a radio or a microphone, picks up a signal or sound, it receives it or detects it.

example.ex: We can pick up Italian television...
example.tran: 我们能收看到意大利电视台的节目。

example.ex: The crew of Philante picked up a distress signal from the yacht Sans Peur III.
example.tran: “菲蓝特”的船员接收到了“无畏者三号”游艇发出的遇险信号。

entry.def: If you pick up something, such as a feature or a pattern, you discover or identify it.
entry.tran: 发现，找到，识别（特点或模式）

example.ex: Consumers in Europe are slow to pick up trends in the use of information technology.
example.tran: 欧洲消费者在辨别信息技术应用的潮流上表现迟缓。

entry.def: If someone picks up a point or topic that has already been mentioned, or if they pick up on it, they refer to it or develop it.

example.ex: Can I just pick up that gentleman's point?...
example.tran: 我能接着那位先生的意思往下说吗？

example.ex: I'll pick up on what I said a couple of minutes ago.
example.tran: 我将回到几分钟前我说过的内容。

entry.def: If trade or the economy of a country picks up, it improves.

example.ex: Chinese officials hope that trade will pick up when the two countries switch to hard currency...
example.tran: 中方官员希望两国在转向使用硬通货后，贸易会有起色。

example.ex: Industrial production is beginning to pick up.
example.tran: 工业生产开始好转。

entry.def: If someone picks up, or their health picks up, they get better.

example.ex: A good dose of tonic will help you to pick up.
example.tran: 一剂好的补品将有助于身体康复。

entry.def: If you pick someone up on something that they have said or done, you mention it and tell them that you think it is wrong.

example.ex: ...if I may pick you up on that point...
example.tran: 请允许我指出你在那一点上的错误…

example.ex: Don't pick me up on words.
example.tran: 不要挑我的措词。

means.word_mean: 1. take and lift upward
2. take up by hand;

sentences.sentence: "He picked up the book and started to read"

means.word_mean: 3. give a passenger or a hitchhiker a lift;

sentences.sentence: "We picked up a hitchhiker on the highway"

means.word_mean: 4. gather or collect;

sentences.sentence: "You can get the results on Monday"
"She picked up the children at the day care center"
"They pick up our trash twice a week"

means.word_mean: 5. get to know or become aware of, usually accidentally;

sentences.sentence: "I learned that she has two grown-up children"
"I see that you have been promoted"

means.word_mean: 6. get in addition, as an increase;

sentences.sentence: "The candidate picked up thousands of votes after his visit to the nursing home"

means.word_mean: 7. take into custody;

sentences.sentence: "the police nabbed the suspected criminals"

means.word_mean: 8. buy casually or spontaneously;

sentences.sentence: "I picked up some food for a snack"

means.word_mean: 9. recieve (perceptual input);

sentences.sentence: "pick up a signal"

means.word_mean: 10. lift out or reflect from a background;

sentences.sentence: "The scarf picks up the color of the skirt"
"His eyes picked up his smile"

means.word_mean: 11. meet someone for sexual purposes;

sentences.sentence: "he always tries to pick up girls in bars"

means.word_mean: 12. fill with high spirits; fill with optimism;

sentences.sentence: "Music can uplift your spirits"

means.word_mean: 13. get better;

sentences.sentence: "Her performance in school picked up"

means.word_mean: 14. perceive with the senses quickly, suddenly, or momentarily;

sentences.sentence: "I caught the aroma of coffee"
"He caught the allusion in her glance"
"ears open to catch every sound"
"The dog picked up the scent"
"Catch a glimpse"

means.word_mean: 15. eat by pecking at, like a bird
16. gain or regain energy;

sentences.sentence: "I picked up after a nap"

word_mean: 临时凑合起来进行比赛

means.word_mean: 拾起, 捡起; 抬起

sentences.en: He picked up the child and put her on his shoulders.
sentences.cn: 他抱起孩子, 让她骑在自己的肩膀上。

sentences.en: I picked up your book by mistake.
sentences.cn: 我拿错了你的书。

sentences.en: I would have picked it up if I had noticed it.
sentences.cn: 我如果看见的话, 我早就把它拣起来了。

means.word_mean: 安排接取; 使搭乘; 搭救

sentences.en: The ship calls at each port on this coast to pick up passengers and mail.
sentences.cn: 那艘轮船在沿海每个港口停下, 搭载乘客和接取邮件。

sentences.en: Please wait at the school gate. John will pick you up there.
sentences.cn: 请在校门口等候, 约翰会到那里接你。

sentences.en: The shipwrecked sailors were picked up by a passing boat.
sentences.cn: 一艘过路的船只搭救了遭受船难的水手。

means.word_mean: 爬〔站〕起来; 振作起来

sentences.en: His spirits picked up.
sentences.cn: 他的精神振奋起来了。

sentences.en: Pick yourself up and brush yourself down.
sentences.cn: 自己爬起来, 把衣服掸干净。

sentences.en: It's hard to pick yourself up after such a terrible shock.
sentences.cn: 经历这样可怕的打击后, 就很难再振奋起来了。

means.word_mean: 使增加〔加快〕

sentences.en: The car began to pick up the moment the vehicle got onto the motorway.
sentences.cn: 一开上高速公路, 车子的速度就加快了。

sentences.en: The car picks up speed with just a touch of the accelerator.
sentences.cn: 这辆车只要你一触加速器就会加速。

means.word_mean: 收拾东西〔屋子〕

sentences.en: Children, it's time to pick up and have supper.
sentences.cn: 孩子们, 该收拾吃晚饭了。

sentences.en: Pick up your room before you go out, please.
sentences.cn: 请在离开之前整理好房间。

sentences.en: The room must be picked up before the guests arrive.
sentences.cn: 这个房间在客人到达之前必须收拾出来。

means.word_mean: 掘, 挖

sentences.en: The peasants were picking up in the field.
sentences.cn: 农民们在田里翻地。

sentences.en: The man was picking up the ground very hard.
sentences.cn: 那个人正在使劲地挖地。

sentences.en: The frozen ground will have to be picked up by hand before machine digging can begin.
sentences.cn: 这冻土必须挖过后才能用掘土机掘土。

means.word_mean: 染上

sentences.en: He must have picked up a cold—he's begun to snuffle.
sentences.cn: 他开始鼻塞, 一定是感冒了。

means.word_mean: 捉住, 逮住

sentences.en: He was implicated in a murder, and sooner or later they would pick him up.
sentences.cn: 他和一宗凶杀案有牵连, 迟早他们会逮捕他的。

sentences.en: He is picked up on a charge of killing a man.
sentences.cn: 他因犯有杀人罪而被逮捕。

means.word_mean: 好转; 恢复

sentences.en: When is the weather going to pick up? It's been bad for weeks.
sentences.cn: 天气什么时候转好?几周来一直很糟糕。

sentences.en: Trade has been slack for the past six months, but it is now picking up.
sentences.cn: 在过去六个月中贸易一直不景气, 但现在状况正在好转。

sentences.en: He has picked up slowly since he came out of hospital.
sentences.cn: 他自出院以来, 身体恢复得很慢。

sentences.en: The writer's personal appearance picked up the sales of the book considerably.
sentences.cn: 那位作家亲自到场, 使那本书的销售量大增。

sentences.en: A bit of exercise will pick you up.
sentences.cn: 你稍微运动运动就会恢复健康的。

means.word_mean: (跌倒后)使(自己)起来，再爬起来
(尤指偶然地、无意地、不费劲地)得到；偶然获得，偶然找到；无意地学会(技术、语言、游戏等)；无师自通地学会；理解；懂得；意识到；注意到

sentences.en: She picks up a lot of imformation.
sentences.cn: 她偶然得到许多信息。

means.word_mean: 停下来把…带走；中途把…带走

sentences.en: Will you please pick up my parcel at the post office as you pass by?
sentences.cn: 请你路过邮局时把我的包裹带回来好吗?

means.word_mean: 把(某人)拘留起来；逮捕；捉到；拿获(罪犯等)

sentences.en: The prisoners who had missed from the place of reform through labour were picked up within 24 hours.
sentences.cn: 从劳改场所逃走的囚犯在24小时之内被捉到了。

means.word_mean: (病后)恢复健康、体力等；好转

sentences.en: This tonic should pick you up .
sentences.cn: 这种补药会增强你的体质。

means.word_mean: 中断后重新开始(活动、叙述等)；重新开始

sentences.en: The engine coughed for a few minutes,and then picked up.
sentences.cn: 发动机嘭嘭地响了几分钟，然后又重新开动了。

means.word_mean: (在广播、电视里)收听、收看到；(用雷达、探照灯等)看到，偶然发现
收进或接受(账单)准备付款

sentences.en: It is the custom for the new wife's father to pick up the bill for the wedding.
sentences.cn: 由新娘的父亲承担婚礼的费用这是个惯例。

means.word_mean: (偶然、随便地)结识、结交(尤指结交与之发生性关系的异性)

sentences.en: He went home with a girl he'd picked up at a party.
sentences.cn: 他带着一个在宴会上结识的姑娘回家。

means.word_mean: 通过实践学会

sentences.en: She soon picked up French when she went to live in France.
sentences.cn: 她到法国居住后很快就学会了法语。

sentences.en: The children have picked up the local accent.
sentences.cn: 孩子们已经学会了当地的口音。</seg>

sentences.en: Don't pick me up on words.

sentences.cn: 狗看到那人捡起一块石头向它砸来时就逃跑了.
sentences.en: The dog turned tail when he saw the man pick up a stone to throw at him.

sentences.cn: 吉姆弯腰捡起钢笔时, 觉得背部一阵刺痛.
sentences.en: As Jim bent over to pick up the pen, he felt a sharp pain in his back.

sentences.cn: 他们相信游客会自觉捡起垃圾。
sentences.en: They depend on the goodwill of visitors to pick up rubbish.

sentences.cn: 这不是你半个小时就能学会的小窍门。
sentences.en: It is not just a little trick you can pick up in half an hour.
